title: kompozme
author: kompozme
content: Hello everyoneMy friend and I have been actively trading futures for over a year, and we've had some good results. We believe we can help others navigate the crypto market with our expertise. However, we understand that trust is crucial, especially with so many scams out there.That's why we're hosting a special event from the 29th of May to the 4th of June, where we'll be sharing our signals for free! You can check them out, compare them with the market, and see the value we bring. We believe this showcase will help build trust in our abilities to assist you.Additionally, we're committed to creating a community dedicated to responsible crypto investing. We value integrity, respect, and supporting one another's success. If you're interested, here's the link to our Discord server: https://discord.gg/VF48njT5bHFeel free to reach out if you have any questions. We're here to help you succeed!Note: I am still in the process of setting up the discord server(channels, coding the bots, and writing rules and all ), so the server might look a little empty for nowÂ  ðŸ˜…

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Discord is better than Telegram for project management. As a project team, they will be able to manage their project, announcement, support, upgrade in Discord better than in Telegram. With Discord, you can create different sub-channels with many options to manage it. It is helpful to reduce spam messages and more effectively spreads important announcements, guides for your users.However, similar to Telegram, in Discord, you will be messaged by many scammers or impersonators. They will send you DMs or invite you to join scam groups. You must know how to detect impersonators in Discord. Always be carefully with any link sent by someone.Discord & scammers. Check user IDs and user colors of strangers send you PMsCan tokens bypass 2FA and SMS auth, and if they can, how do I defend myself against hacking?Policy & Safety: Common scams and what to look out for

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: I don't know about your signals and their accuracy but the thing is confirmed that crypto trading in the form of futures is the riskiest thing one can ever delve into without proper knowledge about trading, and giving trading signals that are of futures can turn into a disaster for the user if it doesn't work for them.There isn't a way to have a perfect signal in the world of crypto because news can impact the market far more than any other thing. If out of nowhere a news comes after you give the signal and the user purchased the coins according to the signal then they might be at risk of loosing a lot form the signal.If you really think that you're a good trader and you're providing good signals then you should share your signals here for free and also share your trading results so that people might be cautious before delving into your signals. Just share some of your previous trades with the signals and let the users know about your skills and if they find you reliable then you might get some users in your server.

Just like the users above said, you want to earn trust and post a few of your signals here, but obviously before the pump or dump happens, and not 10k volume coins either, cause otherwise you will be just one of the rest and we already have way too many.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: kompozme on May 17, 2023, 04:10:06 AMAbout this:Â  Our goal is to create a community and this is why we are going with Discord, We have sub-channels aimed at different crypto topics like market sentiments, where people can share their thought, It is not just about giving out signals, that would be boring ðŸ˜…Why not focus on the community-building part then? I see no reason why you'd try to give signal services. Sharing educational materials as mentioned above is better. You can monetize the content as long as it is useful and unique compared to other educational resources out there. You can also build a bot like what Etherdrop did if you want better profit. I think that would be more appreciated compared to paid signal groups.Quote from: kompozme on May 17, 2023, 04:10:06 AMStill, earning trust and building a community is going to be quite complex ðŸ˜…, we are still thinking about how to do it the right way and be fair about it To be honest I'd avoid sharing signals altogether. Even if you can build some trust by sharing signals, it is very easy to get broken. One or two 'bad' signals can give affect your image. Having "our signals are not always accurate" won't help either since it doesn't make you more unique than dozens of signal groups out there.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: joniboini on May 19, 2023, 12:47:02 AMTo be honest I'd avoid sharing signals altogether. Even if you can build some trust by sharing signals, it is very easy to get broken. One or two 'bad' signals can give affect your image. Having "our signals are not always accurate" won't help either since it doesn't make you more unique than dozens of signal groups out there.No free lunch.If you find a signal with a coin which has not too big trading volume, you should never share that signal. With small trading volume, sharing it will make some impacts on that coin price when more people amongst your signal receivers will buy and sell it.If you buy it previously before sharing the signal, you can enjoy new capital flow from signal receivers and you can have higher price to take profit. However, it will result in bigger selling pressure later.I guess signal providers usually buy ahead of signal receivers and it's no free lunch for receivers. The later they receive signals and enter market, the bigger risk from higher entry price for them.

comments.author: safar1980
comments.body: If you're short on trading ideas, check out TradingView. Opinions and reviews of traders there are free and traders have a rating. There is also a lot of educational information on the Internet on trading.And it doesn't matter if the signal is paid or free, if you follow other people's signals, then you will not learn how to trade and find errors.
